intro: Galium brachiatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Galium brachiatum is often found in the Pacific Northwest and is noted for its delicate appearance and ecological importance to pollinators.
